raw.title: [BIP-615] Enable gauge for USDC/GYD & USDT/GYD [zkEVM]
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1000

### Summary
This is a proposal to enable two uncapped Balancer gauges for USDC/GYD and USDT/GYD E-CLPs on Polygon zkEVM. The pools are not yield-bearing.

---

### References/Useful links
* [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps#description-of-e-clps)
* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

---

### Protocol description
* GYD is a USD denominated meta-stablecoin with several design innovations that put risk control on autopilot. GYD is issued by the [Gyroscope](https://gyro.finance/) protocol. 
* USDT is a USD denominated stablecoin issued by [Tether](https://tether.to/en/).
* USDC is a USD denominated stablecoin issued by [Circle](https://www.circle.com/en/).

---

### Motivation
Gyroscope has expanded its GYD availability to zkEVM and created two core pools for a future liquidity network around GYD on zkEVM.

---

### Specifications
#### Governance
The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

 #### Oracles
 n/a

#### Audits
Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.

#### Centralization vectors
No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.

#### Market History
The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).

## Value
As per “Motivation”.

---

#### Contracts
* USDC/ GYD
  *  E-CLP: [0xd4ec150896f1784b5be2b3af460d2cb2b8c0f522](https://zkevm.polygonscan.com//address/0xd4ec150896f1784b5be2b3af460d2cb2b8c0f522)
  * Childchain gauge on Polygon zkEVM: [0xB049896B3eDcea20dD92c94C706DC67EEa354e57](https://zkevm.polygonscan.com/address/0xB049896B3eDcea20dD92c94C706DC67EEa354e57)
  * Polygon zkEVM root gauge on Ethereum: [0x8806BdF4D6aEB1E3b35bea43835abFAA601BC7b5](https://etherscan.io/address/0x8806BdF4D6aEB1E3b35bea43835abFAA601BC7b5)
 * USDT/ GYD
   * E-CLP: [0xF596ac9c9b60F9C555B8290c2b039C275396afb4](https://zkevm.polygonscan.com/address/0xf596ac9c9b60f9c555b8290c2b039c275396afb4)
   * Childchain gauge on Polygon zkEVM: [0x62AbD51DA1927ae9020264A31F31F07948f31213](https://zkevm.polygonscan.com/address/0x62AbD51DA1927ae9020264A31F31F07948f31213)
   * Polygon zkEVM root gauge on Ethereum: [0xab973781729714Cf85849C00A015615997325985](https://etherscan.io/address/0xab973781729714Cf85849C00A015615997325985)

---

> Specification
>
> Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
> gauge(address): `0x8806BdF4D6aEB1E3b35bea43835abFAA601BC7b5`
> gaugeType(string): `PolygonZkEvm` 
> gauge(address): `0xab973781729714Cf85849C00A015615997325985`
> gaugeType(string): `PolygonZkEvm`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-620] Enable gauge for wstETH/WETH E-CLP [Gnosis]
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1027

### Summary 
This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge for a wstETH/ WETH E-CLP on Gnosis Chain. 

E-CLP's asymmetric concentrated liquidity profile offers capital efficiency improvements. As per previous arrangements between Balancer and Gnosis this pool shall not bear any protocol fees for the time being.

### References/Useful links
* [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

---

### Protocol description
* "wstETH is a wrapped version of stETH. [..] wstETH keeps your balance of stETH fixed and uses an underlying share system to reflect your staking rewards." - [Lido](https://help.lido.fi/en/articles/5231836-what-is-lido-s-wsteth)
* WETH is an ERC-20 compliant wrapper of ETH.
---

### Motivation
Gyroscope is expanding to Gnosis Chain.

---

### Specifications
#### Governance
The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

 #### Oracles
-  'rateProvider0': WETH rate provider on Gnosis Chain: 0x00
- 'rateProvider1': wstETH rate provider on Gnosis Chain: [0x09f9611FE9d24c6A518f656E925e3628A2ECDE3b](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x09f9611FE9d24c6A518f656E925e3628A2ECDE3b)
#### Audits
Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.

#### Centralization vectors
No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.

#### Market History
The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).

## Value
As per “Motivation”.

---

#### Contracts
- E-CLP: [0x8DD4df4Ce580b9644437f3375e54f1ab09808228](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x8DD4df4Ce580b9644437f3375e54f1ab09808228)
- Childchain gauge on Gnosis Chain: [0xa1fF1e44E4f8346398767f94ae7DbeAB71522164](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xa1fF1e44E4f8346398767f94ae7DbeAB71522164)
- Gnosis Chain root gauge on Ethereum: [0x6d060a785530cB13795b3c5a43320c462811d43b](https://etherscan.io/address/0x6d060a785530cB13795b3c5a43320c462811d43b)

---

> Specification
>
> Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
> gauge(address): `0x6d060a785530cB13795b3c5a43320c462811d43b`
> gaugeType(string): `Gnosis`

raw.title: [BIP-616] Enable gauge for sDAI/aUSDC Rehype pool [Gnosis]
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1001

### Summary 
This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge for an sDAI/aUSDC Rehype Pool on Gnosis Chain. 

Rehype Pools hold at least one Aave deposit receipt token and thus allow LPs to receive the lending market yield, in addition to swap fee revenue, and third-party incentives. Rehype Pools build on top of the E-CLP's asymmetric concentrated liquidity profile, improving capital efficiency on two fronts. As per previous arrangements between Balancer and Gnosis this pool shall not bear any protocol fees for the time being.

### References/Useful links
* [Documentation of Rehype Pools](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/rehype-e-clps)
* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

---

### Protocol description
* "Savings Dai (sDAI) is a tokenized representation of Dai deposited in the Dai Savings Rate (DSR) offered by MakerDAO. The sDAI token enables users to receive returns on their DSR deposits while still being able to transfer, stake, lend and use it in any way they want." - [Spark](https://docs.spark.fi/defi-infrastructure/sdai-overview)
* aUSDC is the deposit receipt token issued by the [Aave](https://aave.com/) protocol to lenders of USDC. Since aTokens are rebasing, this pool uses BGD Labs's [statA wrapper](https://github.com/bgd-labs/static-a-token-v3) that is a repricing representation of statA tokens that reflects the accruing lending yield.

---

### Motivation
Gyroscope is expanding to Gnosis Chain.

---

### Specifications
#### Governance
The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

 #### Oracles
 n/a

#### Audits
Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.

#### Centralization vectors
No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.

#### Market History
The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).

## Value
As per “Motivation”.

---

#### Contracts
- Rehype pool: [0x045200C6077f105023000D803F3F95B16B187D70](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x045200c6077f105023000d803f3f95b16b187d70)
- Childchain gauge on Gnosis Chain: [0xFd0D023CeDbb1690e6d602Bc051F06efED8460Dc](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xfd0d023cedbb1690e6d602bc051f06efed8460dc)
- Gnosis Chain root gauge on Ethereum: [0xc6710f32c9524b4C6736fEae17BE7c88bB8fF87c](https://etherscan.io/address/0xc6710f32c9524b4C6736fEae17BE7c88bB8fF87c)

---

> Specification
>
> Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
> gauge(address): `0xc6710f32c9524b4C6736fEae17BE7c88bB8fF87c`
> gaugeType(string): `Gnosis`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-625] Enable gauge for WETH/rETH on [Gnosis]
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1036

**Summary:**
> * This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge for WETH/rETH on Gnosis chain.
> * E-CLP’s asymmetric concentrated liquidity profile offers capital efficiency improvements. As per previous arrangements between Balancer and Gnosis this pool shall not bear any protocol fees for the time being.

**References/Useful links:**

> * [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
> * [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
> * [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
> * [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
> * [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

**Protocol Description:**

> * [When staking ETH with RocketPool] you will be given a token called rETH. rETH represents both how much ETH you deposited, and when you deposited it. The ratio includes rewards that Rocket Pool node operators earn from: The Beacon Chain itself, Priority fees from block proposals, and MEV rewards from block proposals. - [RocketPool](https://docs.rocketpool.net/guides/staking/overview.html#the-reth-token)
> * WETH is a wrapper-token and an ERC-20 token representing ETH at a 1:1 ratio.
>* The E-CLP uses an internal conversion to avoid a unit drift of yield-accruing tokens.

**Motivation:**

> Gyroscope is expanding to Gnosis Chain.

**Specifications:**
 
**Governance:**
> The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

**Oracles:**

> * ‘rateProvider0’: WETH rate provider on Gnosis Chain: 0x00
> * ‘rateProvider1’: rETH rate provider on Gnosis Chain: [0xdc90e2680094314CEaB45CE15100F6e02cEB7ceD](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xdc90e2680094314CEaB45CE15100F6e02cEB7ceD)

**Audits:**

> Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.

**Centralization vectors:**

> No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.

**Market History:**

> The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).
 
**Value:**

> As per “Motivation”.


**Contracts**

> * E-CLP: [0x71E1179C5e197FA551BEEC85ca2EF8693c61b85b](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x71E1179C5e197FA551BEEC85ca2EF8693c61b85b)
> * Childchain gauge on Gnosis Chain: [0x25F822EB509177e393a32181182ae3981eeE6E53](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x25F822EB509177e393a32181182ae3981eeE6E53)
> * Gnosis Chain root gauge on Ethereum: [0xBf4116cEf22D4565A16696427Eaefc248F47Beb6](https://etherscan.io/address/0xBf4116cEf22D4565A16696427Eaefc248F47Beb6)

Technical Specification: 

Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:

gauge(address): `0xBf4116cEf22D4565A16696427Eaefc248F47Beb6`

gaugeType(string): `Gnosis`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-575] Enable stataArbUSDT/stataArbUSDCn gauge [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/853

> # Summary
> * This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge for stataArbUSDT/stataArbUSDCn on Arbitrum.
> * The underlying pool is a Rehype Pool, an extension of Gyroscope's E-CLPs. Rehype Pools auto-rehypothecate E-CLP assets to Aave and can thus accrue yield from three different sources: (1) Aave lending deposit yield, (2) swap yields from asymmetric concentrated liquidity, and (3) yield from third-party token incentive markets.
> * The pool shall have a swap fee of 0.5 basis points, i.e., 0.005% at pool inception. A protocol fee of 30% will be set upon incentives going live. This may be changed later upon mutual discussion (this is a new Rehype pool type and fees and growth may need to be fine tuned). At pool inception, no fees will go towards Gyroscope.

> # References/Useful links
> * [Documentation of Rehype pools](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/rehype-e-clps#description-of-rehype-e-clps)
> * [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
> * [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
> * [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
> * [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

> # Protocol description
>
>* stataArbUSDT is the wrapped, static version of the rebasing Aave lending deposit token for aUSDT on Arbitrum. - [Aave](https://github.com/bgd-labs/static-a-token-v3)
> * stataArbUSDCn is the wrapped, static version of the rebasing Aave lending deposit token for aUSDC on Arbitrum. - [Aave](https://github.com/bgd-labs/static-a-token-v3)

> # Motivation
>
> Rehype pools reach new efficiency heights while staying simple and therefore safer. Rehype pools embrace a simple, modular design that doesn't introduce new smart contract code for rehypothecation. Rehype pools thus inherit the security record of E-CLPs.
> The complexity of Rehype pools is handled in the more flexible layers of order routing and front end interface instead of in smart contracts.
At the same time, they keep everything transparent on-chain and keep users in control, in contrast to common rehypothecation in TradFi.

> # Specifications
> > ## Governance
> > The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.
> > ## Oracles
> > * rateProvider0 (for stataArbUSDCn): [0x87cD462A781c0ca843EAB131Bf368328848bB6fD](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x87cD462A781c0ca843EAB131Bf368328848bB6fD#readContract)
> > * rateProvider1 (for stataArbUSDT): [0x48942B49B5bB6f3E1d43c204a3F40a4c5F696ef6](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x48942B49B5bB6f3E1d43c204a3F40a4c5F696ef6#code)
> > * (allows to control for a price drift from accruing yield by using rate providers to first convert from yield accruing tokens to the underlying)
> > * Reviews for these rate providers can be verified as SAFE [here](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/pull/34/files#diff-5861d38cee7220a0b2672cd05e4233e4058bdc3c7c0d4aa1f7a5e00979bfee8b). 
>>
> > ## Audits
> > Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification for the underlying E-CLP can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022. 'Rehype Pools' are an extension of E-CLP that supports Aave's statA tokens and outsources much of the complexity of 'Boosted Pools' to order routers.
> > ## Centralization vectors
> > No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.
> > ## Market History
> > The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).
> > ## Value
> > As per “Motivation”.
> > ## Contracts
> > * stataOptUSDT/stataOptUSDCn Rehype pool: [0x125bC5a031B2Db6733bfa35d914ffa428095978B](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x125bc5a031b2db6733bfa35d914ffa428095978b)
> > * Childchain gauge on Arbitrum: [0x2b52a321Fc2ab77e9fC8488D792BB3CaEA966c0b](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x2b52a321Fc2ab77e9fC8488D792BB3CaEA966c0b#readContract)
> > * Arbitrum root gauge on Ethereum: [0xBB034E493eBF45F874e038Ae76576Df9Cc1137e5](https://etherscan.io/address/0xBB034E493eBF45F874e038Ae76576Df9Cc1137e5#readContract)

> Specification
> Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
> gauge(address): `0xBB034E493eBF45F874e038Ae76576Df9Cc1137e5`
> gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal to enable two uncapped Balancer gauges for GYD/aUSDC and GYD/aUSDT Rehype Pools on Arbitrum is recommended for approval, supported by unanimous voting and consistent governance trends from similar past proposals.
key_arguments_for: All votes (9/9) support enabling the new gauges, showing strong governance consensus.
Similar past proposals with unanimous 'Yes' votes successfully aimed to fund and operate key protocol components.
Enabling these gauges supports Gyroscope's management and bootstraps the Rehype Pools sustainably with a protocol fee.
The proposal aligns with Balancer's goal to expand and support liquidity and governance on Arbitrum.
key_arguments_against: Forum discussion shows mixed sentiment with one negative and one neutral comment, indicating some community concerns.
Market impacts in similar proposals showed modest price and TVL declines, suggesting some risk.

evidence.quote: Two comments before deadline: one negative expressing concerns about protocol fee, one neutral explaining fee impact on STIP and ARB distributions.
All votes favor 'Yes, let's do it' with perfect lead ratios and stability.

evidence.reference: Similar past proposals BIP-635 and BIP-634
evidence.quote: Both had unanimous 'Yes' votes and aimed at business development and funding operations.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• Unanimous voting and timeline metrics strongly favor 'Yes, let's do it', indicating strong governance consensus.
• Similar historical proposals with unanimous 'Yes' votes aimed at funding and operational enhancements, setting a positive precedent for change.
• Forum sentiment is mixed but limited, with one negative and one neutral comment; overall sentiment does not strongly oppose the recommendation.
• Market impacts in similar proposals showed modest declines, but these do not outweigh governance benefits and protocol operational goals.
• The recommendation aligns with the protocol's long-term health by enabling sustainable liquidity management and governance participation.
